reviewText:
Summary:

Pros:
-Achievements easy to get

Cons:
-Hard to progress in the game
-Linear Gameplay (pretty much point and shoot, walk from A to B)
-Grammar pretty bad
-Instructions not explained well
-Enemies too tough first time around (1 life for 1 enemy)
-Enemies respawn too quickly
-No Manual Save Game!
-Graphics aren't top notch, but for $3 guess it's ok

Decided to try this out, conversations between NPCs were first to get my attention. They speak different languages with some english words inserted in the dialouge but there are english texts to accompany them, although the grammar's relatively poor. Gameplay's linear (go from A to B), you move pretty slow despite running and pretty much a point and shoot on one kind of an enemy early in the game. Graphics-wise it isn't top notch (depsite the max settings), although it's not going to bother you if you don't really care about those types of details.

Upgrading your gear isn't really well explained at the beginning of the game, just some form of text description on some of the recipes to craft upgrades but you are really only given a vague idea of how to go about it. You'll figure it out yourself - considering the fact that the enemies are very tough to deal with even at the beginning of the game, upgrading your gear is essential. It seems without upgrades at all it'll be one kill - one death, then you respawn at the furthest stage (e.g. You started stage A and got killed in stage D, you respawn back to A with respawned enemies which you have to kill again). With minimal upgrades you'll manage to get 2-1 KD, but otherwise don't bet on sweeping stages easily.

Lastly and also one of the most disappointing features of this game - No Saves! Or rather, it autosaves only on essential cutscenes with NPC, otherwise quitting afterwards will delete any progress you have made in the game - that means upgrades, inventory items, money, progress, etc. This no longer makes the game any more enticing to replay after one session.

Overall won't really recommend this game right now, as you can tell from the review already. There much better ones out there to get. If they can remedy most of the cons, I say for $3 it's ok to purchase but wait for an update.
voteText: 77 of 85 people (91%) found this review helpful 5 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Unlocking locks simulator 2015.

First things first: this game is very well made in the sense that everything is high quality (animations, world, special effects).

I was really impressed, and decided to continue to see how far into the game I could get.  Unfortunately, it seems like the core mechanics of the game are not fun.  You literally just open locks the whole time.  It took me awhile to figure out how to open the locks, and I am still not 100% sure of which items I need to have in my inventory, as there are 3 different tiles of each color of lock unlocking elements.  The descriptions hardly indicate what you would need, but it appears you need to get an empty jar, put the element in it, then you have a jar full of that element, then you need to click on it again and press 'use' and it creates another identical type of jar with the same description with a slightly different icon in the image and you need this to open a lock.  After an hour I still had no idea how to do it but you can just click on everything and you'll get that lock open.  [edit: it appears after watching someone else play that that identical jar type is a crafting ingredient!  So you need to have the crafting jar, the empty jar, and the element, to create a full jar, It would have been much easier if we didn't need the crafting jar]

And then there are robots that want to kill you.  It's pretty fun having to battle them, although they are pretty powerful and you may end up dying a lot.  I found it entertaining until I saw that the robots just spawn randomly and constantly so you can't exactly clear" them all out
date: you just have to deal with whatever is in front of you
recommended: just long enough to open the lock (while you are mashing the buttons in your inventory trying to create the right type of jar).\n\nSo from a quality standpoint
voteText: but as far as "fun" I would say that I do not recommend jar creator/lock opener simulator.  PLEASE tell me that there is something beyond the locks.  If so
helpfulPercent:
I will do it.  I will open all the locks if there is something of enjoyment on the other side besides more locks.

AND LET US RUN!!!

PLEASE!!

The game has a not-visible stamina bar
votesHelpful: so you have to walk most of the time.  You can run for like 10 seconds
votesTotal: then walking.  Try to run again and you will have like 0.1 second of run
votesFunny: then back to walking.  The gameplay is so frustrating and annoying that the least you could do is let us run around!!\n\nAlso
commentsCount: the english translation in the game is really extremely bad

but that's at least skippable.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_Fs986AxfJs

^ here is me stumbling around trying to figure it out for an hour."

reviewText:
I have no idea where to even start with this game. It's a technical disaster; I had to keep the game at a low resolution because upping it past 720 locked my mouse cursor from going too far to the right. The screen tearing will make your eyes hurt. The character models...need to be seen to be believed.

If you're an English speaker, then good luck trying to figure out what the game wants from you. The text-to-speech voiced dialogue is in another language and the subtitles are in very, very broken English.

I played the game for 30 minutes, and the only positive thing I can really say is that the achievements are super easy to unlock.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9SynoOdvycc

reviewText:
Public Review on behalf of the Opium Pulses Steam group
Disclaimer: The copy of this game was provided by Orlygift[www.orlygift.com]. Thank you for making this review possible!

Few words about the game
Botology is a game where... I'm not even sure what's going on as it's explained with twisted and badly translated english. Intro tries to explain bits of backstory but it's hard to catch up even there. When you get into a proper game finally, you just go forward, without any clear instructions, just walk and hope you'll get somewhere. Once you get gun and some kind of objective... oh boy that's where fun begins. By fun, I mean grind at every corner. Literally. One of the most repetitive games I have seen in a while. Only thing that is good(ish) is music in main menu, that's all.

Advantages
Graphics here and there but only partially
As mentioned, music in main menu. Hey, it's something!
Disadvantages
Everything is translated into weird, broken English. It's hard to even partially understand what's going on and what you're supposed to do
Controls are weird and not really understandable thanks to translation that explains everything in default controls
There is no vocing, everything is voiced" by some speech synthesizer. There's also no language used
date: just gibberish with random words used here and there\nGameplay is repetitive
recommended: all you have to do is kill enemies and unlock different types of locks
hoursPlayed: over and over again\nTutorial teaches us nothing and even if it does
voteText: it does it really unclearly\nAnimations and mechanics are compareable to game made in 2000s\nFull of bugs everywhere (I fell through textures
votesHelpful: walked on water e.t.c.)\nSummary\nGame is not worth time or money spent on it. Even achievements are easy to get but to 100% complete them
votesTotal: you need to pass whole game
votesFunny: good luck with that. Game is very below average
commentsCount:
totally not recommended.

Personal score
2.5 / 10
If you find my review helpful or funny be sure to follow Opium Pulses curator page right here for more reviewed games!"

reviewText:
Pros:
Game was on sale for under a dollar.
It's so awful I wrote my first review.
The gameplay is so bad I wrote my first guide.
Cons:
Game controls are terrible and clunky
Using items is terrible
Crafting items is terrible
Inventory doesn't sort nicely
Gun doesn't auto-reload
Aiming is terrible, the projectiles do not line up with the target.
English Text-to-Speech (TURN THIS OFF ASAP)
Enemy AI is terrible... enemies can shoot through objects, walls & visual obstructions
Enemies infinitely respawn, and respawn quickly making it excessively tedious to complete the levels.
Pointless locks... really pointless locks... did I mention there are a ton of them?
Elevators go up and down automatically (don't strafe in an elevator)
The game doesn't pause, whether in inventory or menu.

reviewText:
There's a worthwhile game lurking in this one; the story has the potential to be fairly interesting, but this is ripped away by the way that so much is told immediately in the prologue, and uninterestingly so. The gameplay is a pain; it's easy to get stuck in strange places, the camera is atrocious, and you have to hold shift to get around with any speed at all. This mayb e corrected later.

The environment is pretty decent, and with all the NPCs walking around the opening area, it does feel like a living world.

I hope this creator is still making things; there's a definite talent lurking here. It just needs a lot of polish.

Go to Store (Featured), Click on Games, Narrow by Feature (Steam Trading Cards), Relevance (Lowest Price).
Then skip to Page 9 or 10, until you find the .50 - $1.00 games.
Add them to your Wishlist, games that are a dollar can go on sale and you may be able to purchase for cheap!
A game at .50 may give you that value back in trading cards.
Search and Install Idle Master" which will run your games even without the game being installed.

I may or may not ever play this game

reviewText:
AVOID THIS GAME IF YOU HAVE WINDOWS 10! If you read nothing else, read that.

I got the game as a joke, to see just how bad it could possibly be. I was going to write a review detailing the game. I was going to give you guys the benefit of a doubt.
That will not happen because the game WILL NOT launch.

Let me explain. Most gamers now have Windows 10, including me. This game apparently only works with Windows 7, for whatever reason. Here's the thing though, nothing you do will get the game to launch with Windows 10. No compatability settings will do it. And you know what the worst part is? It's not crashing, it just refuses to go past the menu screen. Will not budge. I press Start"
date: the UI disappears and nothing happens. I press "Continue" and again
recommended: nothing happens. "Options" brings up the options menu
hoursPlayed: but what good is it? How am I supposed to review the game if I can't play it anymore?\n\nI've played the game on Windows 7 before I upgraded
voteText: and it was the blandest
helpfulPercent: and one of the most boring games I've ever played. That's all I can say.\n\nYou know what's worse than a game that has terrible gameplay? A game that doesn't work and can't be fixed."
